document.masterDocTitle: A revision of the genus Belciana Walker, 1862 with description of three new species (Lepidoptera, Noctuidae: Pantheinae) from East and South East Asia. Revision of Pantheinae, contribution XII

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A revision of the genus Belciana Walker, 1862 with description of three new species (Lepidoptera, Noctuidae: Pantheinae) from East and South East Asia. Revision of Pantheinae, contribution XII

subSubSection.paragraph:
Belciana hemodoides
Holloway, 2009
, The Moths of Borneo 13 : 20 , Pl. 1 : 11 , Holotype : male, Brunei , Ulu Temburong, 300 m , rainforest (NHM).

References .
Kononenko & Pinratana 2005
: 134 , Pl. 39 : 6 (
Belciana biformis
); 2013 : 277 , Pl. 37 : 17 (
Belciana hemodoides
).

Note. The specimen labelled as BC ZSM Lep 65174 has been used for barcoding. Molecular distance based on the Kimura two-parameter model for COI DNA barcodes between nearest
B. hemodoides
and
B. hreblayi
is 5,42 %.

Diagnosis. Adult (
Fig. 5, 6
). Wingspan 36–43 mm . The species is close to
B. biformis
having deeper bluishgreen ground colour of forewing and more developed dark-brown elements of wing pattern in subbasal and subterminal fields. Medial field with pale greyish medial shadow bordered with diffused white lines; orbicular as white diffused spot, reniform as transversal blackish streak, separated for two dots; subterminal line blackish with irregular white bordering, sometimes broken for large separate dashes; apical, subapical and tornal areas brown with blackish dashes, more developed compared with
B. biformis .
The hindwing are dull greyish-brown, paler yellowish-grey towards base and along anal margin; in some specimens medial discal spot and fascia are traceable.

Male genitalia (
Fig. 33
). Differs from
B. biformis
by more solid uncus, somewhat narrow and less membranous valva with less developed basal coremata, by stronger ventral margin; wider and more acute shape of harpe. Aedeagus with dorsal branch of carina bearing short finger-like extension (absent in
B. biformis
); vesica basally bulbous, tubular apically, with 6–8 moderate cornuti; ventral branch of carina with patch of small spines more dispersed than in
B. biformis .

Female genitalia (
Fig. 44
). In the female genitalia antrum narrower than in
B. biformis
, split; ductus bursae shorter than in
B. biformis
, sclerotised patch in joining of ductus and corpus bursae more clearly formed and more sclerotised than in
B. biformis
, having quadrangular shape; the main part of corpus bursae is longer than in
B. biformis
, with broad clear caudal-lateral extension; the bottom of corpus bursae is slightly taper, rather than be rounded like in
B. biformis .

Distribution and bionomics. * Vietnam (Lao Cai), * Thailand (Prov. Nakhon Ratchasima, Chumphon), Singapore , Malaysia , Borneo (Prov. Kalimantan, Timur, Prov. Daerah Tingkat and Kalimantan Barat), Brunei (Seria, Ulu Temburong), Indonesia (Great Sunda Islands), * Philippines (Isl. Leyte, Luzon, Mindoro, Palawan, Samar). The species occurs in lowland and mountain areas at elevation range 300–1700 m . Moths flying in January, April, September, December.
The most widespread species of the genus, reported here for Vietnam , Thailand and Philippines for the first time.
